page.title: 18FARMING
page.content: One farmer runs a large flock of {sheep}on his land. He has three farms which are worked as one large unit, and several other isolated fields in other villages. A large proportion of his land is not included in this block. The sheep are kept primarily for meat, the lambs being a more important crop than the wool. The ewes are kept on unimproved pasture near the farm during the lambing season, from late March to mid-April. They later move to pasture further from the farm in the summer and autumn, but may be put to eat sugar-beet tops in the early winter, before being moved back near the farm, when their feed may be supplemented with hay and concentrated food, depending on their condition and the weather. Some ewe lambs will be retained, or fresh stock bought in, to keep the breeding stock healthy.
